title: ICE "region scope ... not in scope to drop"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Found with a [modified fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/jruderman/fuzz-rustc) ### Code ```Rust #![allow(dead_code)] const N: usize = { struct U; ! let y = 42; 3 }; struct S { x: [(); N] } fn main() {} ``` ### Error output ``` rsr.rs:5:7: error: expected expression, found `let` statement rsr.rs:5:7: error: `let` expressions are not supported here rsr.rs:5:7: error[E0658]: `let` expressions in this position are unstable rsr.rs:5:11: error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/build/scope.rs:935:9: region scope Remainder { block: 11, first_statement_index: 0} not in scope to drop _4 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/7eef946fc0e0eff40e588eab77b09b287accbec3/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:967:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x10e4fa7a2 - ::fmt::hde9930b8710af522 1: 0x10e5525ea - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::ha121f0b94f5d418a 123: 0x7ff814d514e1 - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.0-nightly (7eef946fc 2022-11-06) running on x86_64-apple-darwin query stack during panic: #0 [mir_built] building MIR for `N` #1 [unsafety_check_result] unsafety-checking `N` #2 [mir_const] preparing `N` for borrow checking #3 [mir_const_qualif] const checking `N` #4 [mir_promoted] processing MIR for `N` #5 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `N` #6 [mir_drops_elaborated_and_const_checked] elaborating drops for `N` #7 [mir_for_ctfe] caching mir of `N` for CTFE #8 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `N` #9 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `S::x::{constant#0}` #10 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `S::x::{constant#0}` #11 [eval_to_valtree] evaluating type-level constant #12 [check_well_formed] checking that `S` is well-formed #13 [check_mod_type_wf] checking that types are well-formed in top-level module #14 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```

### Regression Regression in nightly-2021-08-17, maybe from #80357 ### Version ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (7eef946fc 2022-11-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7eef946fc0e0eff40e588eab77b09b287accbec3 commit-date: 2022-11-06 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ```
